titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

div.p: ~~'We are Protestants, not from indifference, but from zeal'~~

body.p: I attended the Installation of Bishop Ryle as Dean of Westr, and, afterwards, had tea in the Jericho Parlour.
Mitford Mitchell, Canon & Mrs Bell, Mr & Mrs Arnold Lupton, & Miss Graham dined here.

All this week I have worked at my "Robert Lee" lecture, and I have written a good deal, not very successfully. Now I am fidgetty about its ultimate fate. The ownership of the Lecture is with the Trustees; & they publish it: but the aspect of the published lectures is more squalid than I like.
